intro: Citrosma cujabana, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and dark, aromatic fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a strong, spicy scent when crushed. Citrosma cujabana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
